intro: Taraxacum pseudofontanum, commonly known as the European dandelion, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of stiff, hairy leaves and a hollow, leafless stem that supports a single flower head. The flower head consists of numerous yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular florets, which mature into the familiar seed-bearing "puffball" structure. The plant is widely distributed across Europe and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
